column1: WHO has published a surveillance protocol for SARS-CoV-2 infection among health workers.
This is a technical tool that countries can use to better understand the characteristics and
exposure risks of health workers infected with COVID-19.
WHO Director-General Dr Tedros, in his regular media briefing, stated the Solidarity Response
Fund will continue to receive donations to support WHO’s activities related to COVID-19, while
the WHO Foundation will help to fund all elements of WHO’s work and be fully aligned with the
Members of the Polio Eradication Initiative at WHO Regional Office for the Eastern
Mediterranean are supporting the training of health workers to respond to COVID-19 in Sudan.

guidance on preparedness, prevention and control of COVID-19 in prisons and other places of
